summary:
• Taliban seeks to reconcile science and religion on climate change.
• This move aims to address environmental challenges.
• Climate change poses significant threats to Afghan communities.

• The British monarch will pay an official state visit to Australia.
• The royal couple will spend several days in the country from October onwards.
• During their trip, they will engage in various activities, including cultural events and diplomatic meetings with local leaders.

• Princess Catherine makes public appearance after cancer diagnosis.
• Olympic torch arrives in Paris for Bastille Day parade.
• Princess Catherine and Olympic torch appear together on Bastille Day.

• A girl in Gambia was secretly circumcised despite her family's opposition.
• The country is considering lifting its ban on female circumcision.
• Female circumcision remains a contentious issue globally due to its cultural significance and human rights implications.

• Germany is implementing a policy that forces certain asylum seekers to take on labor-intensive tasks.
• Asylum seekers in Germany are being compelled to work under duress rather than pursuing employment opportunities of their choice.
• This approach has sparked controversy among human rights advocates who argue it undermines the dignity of refugees seeking refuge in Germany.

• Star-studded Ambani wedding continues with celebrations.
• Asia's richest man hosts lavish, spectacular wedding.
• Event sparks controversy over its opulence and extravagance.

• Senior Hamas commander killed in Israeli airstrike.
• 90 killed in Israeli airstrikes on Gaza targeting Hamas military leader.
• Gaps remain as Israel and Hamas negotiate ceasefire deal.

• Kenya's police under investigation after human remains discovered
• Professors struggle to address abuse allegations in their teaching methods
• Kenyan President replaces controversial cabinet members amidst ongoing protests

• At least 13 children died when a building housing a primary school collapsed in Lagos, Nigeria.
• The incident occurred during lunchtime on a Friday afternoon at the three-story structure built over 50 years ago with multiple extensions.
• Survivors were taken to nearby hospitals for treatment after emergency responders arrived quickly on the scene.

• An individual named Thomas Matthew Crooks is identified in connection with an attempted attack on US President Donald Trump.
• Conspiracy theories and hate speech have spread on social media platforms following the incident.
• Rwandan President Paul Kagame has announced his intention to seek a fourth presidential term.

• Trader Joe's seasoning banned in South Korea due to its popularity
• The seasoning gained widespread use despite being prohibited by law
• Authorities have taken steps to enforce the ban and promote compliance with regulations

• Princess Kate will present the trophy to the men's Wimbledon winner.
• The presentation is confirmed by the palace.
• This highlights her role in supporting British sports achievements.

•	Trump shooter on the roof fires at Trump who is ducked by security
•	Democrats stick with Joe Biden due to his policy stance
•	Gunman kills man who jumps in front of him to protect family

• Education in Zambia was made free by the government.
• As a result, classrooms became overcrowded due to increased demand.
• This has led to challenges in providing quality education amidst the high number of students.
